newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistan newspapers - December 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Pakistan newspapers - December 19.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Pakistani press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Ousted prime minister Benazir Bhutto has warned the government of a mass protest movement if the February 3 polls were subjected to rigging.
- Police have served a fresh arrest order on Bhutto's husband Asif Ali Zardari after his earlier detention was set aside by the Sindh High Court.
- Police have detained former chief minister of Sindh province Abdullah Shah in an alleged land scam case.
- The Ehtesab (accountability) Commission has not received any case against deposed prime minister Bhutto and former prime minister Nawaz Sharif.
- Caretaker Law Minister Fakhruddin Ibrahim resigned after refusing to appoint a nominee of the Chief Justice of Pakistan as law secretary and protesting against amendments in the elections laws.
- Anti-terrorist court judge Chaudhry Zahoor Hussain has been arrested at Lahore on alleged charges of corruption.
- The European Union has excluded Pakistan from the seafood exporters list approved for 1997.
- State (central) Bank of Pakistan Governor, Muhammad Yaqub said the central bank must be restructured and tenure posting of its chief executive should be guaranteed.
- The planned trip of a Pakistani economic delegation for a roadshow in the United Arab Emirates on Wednesday has been postponed at least till Saturday.

- Shahid Javed Burki, finance and economic affairs adviser to the prime minister said the IMF approved Pakistan's request to extend a $600 million standby loan to September from March and to increase it by $231 million.
- Former interior minister Naseerullah Babur has decided to contest general elections set on February 3 from Karachi.
- Six children drowned when their boat overturned in a lake near Nawabshah in southern Sindh province.
